snippet: The members trained by the United States to take on the Islamic State found themselves fighting off an attack from another Islamist faction.
abstract: Syrian insurgent group battling Islamic State is attacked by Nusra Front, another hard-line Islamist faction, dealing crucial setback to United States strategy to create reliable military force inside Syria; US-led coalition launches airstrikes to help American-aligned unit.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Baghdad, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Maher Samaan from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The members trained by the United States to take on the Islamic State found themselves fighting off an attack from another Islamist faction.

headline.main: Rivals of ISIS Attack U.S.-Backed Syrian Rebel Group
headline.print_headline: Rival Insurgents Surprise Syrians Supported by U.S.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
